meanings.definition: To take back possession of something.
meanings.sent1: After losing his toy, Tim managed to reseize it from his brother.
meanings.sent2: The detective had to reseize the stolen painting from the thief.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reseize the yarn ball, but it kept rolling away.
meanings.sent4: She had to reseize control of the situation before it spiraled out of hand.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to reseize his focus in order to win the race.

meanings.sent1: The police had to reseize the escaped criminal before he could flee.
meanings.sent2: The eagle swooped down to reseize its prey from the ground.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reseize the disappearing rabbit, but it was gone.
meanings.sent4: She had to reseize the opportunity before it slipped through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The student had to reseize the concept in order to understand it fully.
